spiritsExplanation:
The workout takes place on the Charles River, as indicated by the title Climbing Intervals Row and the description mentioning on the Charles River, strongly pointing to an Outdoor & Adventure spirit, earning a high score of 0.95. The rowing on water, especially on a natural river setting, aligns closely with exploration and environmental challenges. Additionally, the focus on building rhythm and pace aligns closely with the Flow & Rhythm spirit, as the participants are encouraged to maintain smooth, continuous movement patterns, supported by a rhythmic music playlist featuring songs like Eye Of The Tiger and Don't Stop Me Now. This justifies a strong score of 0.8.

Lastly, with a sweat category and workout intensity level of 2 out of 3, there is a clear effort-driven aspect fitting the High-Energy & Intense spirit, warranting a score of 0.65. The climb format suggests intervals that are likely to engage participants actively in pushing their limits.
